thread.title: Telcos unveil Apple iPhone 6s prices and plans
thread.title_full: Telcos unveil Apple iPhone 6s prices and plans | Business Spectator

author: David Swan
title: Telcos unveil Apple iPhone 6s prices and plans
text:
Apple lifted the lid on its shiny iPhone 6s and 6s Plus models last week and Australians now have a clear picture of how much they’ll be shelling out for the new devices when they launch here on September 25.
The iPhone 6s, which boasts 3D Touch, 4K video recording and a 64-bit A9 chip will be available outright directly from Apple for $1,079 for the 16GB edition, $1,229 for 64GB and $1,379 for the 128GB model.
The iPhone 6s Plus, which packs in a 5.5-inch screen and a bigger battery than its smaller sibling, will cost $1,229 for 16GB, $1,379 for 64GB and $1,529 for the 128GB model.
Both phones are available in Silver, Gold, Space Grey or Rose Gold.
Apple says of the iPhone 6s ‘the only thing that’s changed is everything’ but telco pricing is still a complicated beast, with each of Australia’s major telcos offering the devices on a range of plans at a range of price points with a range of sweeteners.
Telstra is offering the base-level iPhone 6s 16GB model for $87 per month over 24 months including 1GB of data and $550 worth of talk credit.
The telco said all customers on its $95 Go plan also get a bonus 1GB of data - for a total of 7GB - plus a complimentary 24-month Apple Music subscription, which normally retails for $11.99 per month.
Telstra customers can also experience a "New Phone Feeling” after 12 months and trade in their phone for an upgraded model for $149, when Apple inevitably upgrades the iPhone in a year’s time.
Optus isn’t lying down either, offering the 16GB iPhone 6s for $73 per month in a plan that includes 500MB of data per month and unlimited talk and texts.
Vodafone’s cheapest iPhone 6s plan is its $79 per month plan, which includes 1GB of data and unlimited national calls and texts.
The company is also offering a bonus 2GB on selected plans, and has launched what it says is Australia/’s most affordable 20GB smartphone plan, which is available on SIM Only ($85 over24 months) or bundled with a smartphone including the iPhone 6s ($130 over 24 months).
Optus subsidiary Virgin Mobile is offering the iPhone 6s 16GB for $61 per month across 24-months, which includes $300 worth of calls and texts and 300MB of included data.
The telco also launched TweetServe – an automated message response service in which customers can tweet @virginmobileaus using the hashtag #stock followed by the specific handset they are looking for, and @virginmobileaus will send an immediate response.
Australians won’t get access to Apple’s own monthly plan system, which offers US customers an unlocked iPhone and the ability to upgrade it to a new model every 12 months for no extra cost.
The new iPhones will launch September 25, with Apple fans expected to make their yearly camping trip outside flagship stores around the globe. Apple’s new iPad Pro, which ships with a 5.6 million pixel screen and is compatible with the ‘Apple Pencil’ stylus is coming some time in November.
